title: Executive Order 5083-Authorizing the Reinstatement of Emma E. Kennedy Without Regard to Civil Service Rules
content: Mrs. Emma E. Kennedy may be reinstated as an operative in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing without regard to the time limit of the civil service rules upon reinstatement.
Mrs. Kennedy was a classified employee in the Bureau from May, 1917, to February, 1918, and a war emergency employee from September, 1920, to July, 1921.
This order is recommended by the Secretary of the Treasury, who states that her services can again be used in a permanent position. The Civil Service Commission is unable to concur.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5083-Authorizing the Reinstatement of Emma E. Kennedy Without Regard to Civil Service Rules Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360799
